resources.string: Buttons are here for development / testing / debugging will be moved to a menu and then possibly moved out all together. Will be replaced with the map
Unable to use mock GPS locations, no data found
Unable to use mock locations, insufficient privileges
Are you sure you want to empty the databases?\nThis cannot be undone.
All database records have been deleted
Some database records have been deleted, check the log for details
Unable to delete database records, check the log for details
Invalid incident report id detected, no report to display
Missing incident report id, no report to display
No incident data found using supplied report id, no report to display
This marker represents your current estimated location
The Incident Title field is required
The Incident Description field is required
Cannot save report at this time - Unable to determine your location
Cannot save report at this time - A database error occurred
Cannot send report at this time - It was not saved to the database
Cannot send report at this time - A Network error occurred
The Incident Title must be less than %d characters long
The Incident Description must be less than %d characters long

Serval Mapping Services will store geographic location information locally, and will also broadcast it over the network. By continuing, you accept that this information will be broadcast. Serval has no long term repository storage of location details. Communications made using this software are not secure or private and data may also be witnessed by someone other than the intended recipient.
Cannot use application at this time - No map data files available
Cannot use application at this time - Unable to locate the \'%s\' file
Invalid peer record id detected, no info to display
Missing peer record id, no info to display
No peer data found using supplied record id, no info to display

The Mapping Services application is licensed using the GPLv3 license. 

Portions of this software are based on Android example code using the Apache 2.0 license. 

This application is part of the Serval Project and relies on its resilient mesh network technology. 

The mapping capabilities of this application are powered by mapsforge using data sourced from OpenStreetMap licensed under the CC BY-SA 2.0 license. 

The markers are based on the template provided by the Map Icons Collection licensed under the CC BY-SA 3.0 license.
